intro: Pisonia duckei, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Pisonia duckei is often found in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
